item.title: Word by Word
item.description: Stray notes The wonky rules of English! (use the open compound “back seat” in the phrase “take a back seat” but the closed “backseat” when referring to the seats behind the driver, etc etc) Asimov: “My opinions are strong, but not necessarily authoritative.
